DOC.brief_summary: The hypothesis computer simulate bony impingement bone surround spherical glenoid implant ( glenosphere ) along scapular neck three-dimensional ( 3-D ) compute tomography ( CT ) image analysis predictive location clinical scapular notch develops follow reverse total shoulder arthroplasty ( TSA ) .
DOC.brief_title: Prediction Development Scapular Notching Following Reverse Total Shoulder Arthroplasty
DOC.detailed_description: The Specific Aims : - Determine relationship lateral glenoid offset development scapular notching follow reverse TSA - Determine ability 3-D preoperative planning tool define area scapular bony impingement kinematic simulate shoulder range motion predict development scapular notch - Compare precision accuracy plain radiograph ( 2-D ) versus CT ( 3-D ) measurement scapular notch postoperative implant position follow reverse TSA ( 2-D versus 3-D ) - Determine implant anatomic factor best correlate clinical outcome follow reverse TSA retrospective analysis
DOC.criteria: All patient undergone reverse TSA Cleveland Clinic high quality preoperative CT operative shoulder minimum two year surgery All patient undergone reverse TSA Cleveland Clinic preoperative CT low quality preoperative CT operative shoulder and/or less two year surgery
